Now this is a predicament. Being a soft and plushy D&D Pseudo-Summoner (let's face it, not exactly rolling dice here ;p), I rely on my creatures to do my work for me. With only a few tricks to help in certain situations. I decide that I cannot win this fight on this battlefield and prepare for retreat.

I use haste, invisibility and my remaining summons to spawn / detonate a clear path to freedom, hoping to go unnoticed among the chaos.

\*\*\* Honestly, not going to fight over this since it is just a game, but doing trap-laying like that is extremely overpowered. Even if I summon rogue-like creatures to disarm them, you can safely snipe from a distance regardless of me spotting you or not. I don't think I can call forth a true sniper in the likes of you, and I can't close the gap without moving slowly (spot checks) so really all I can do is retreat.

\*\*\* Though, I just realized it MIGHT have been possible to fly over them; depending on the trigger type. Oh well.

I take aim at the sudden notice of a debris field, but I do not see anything through the thick clouds. I quickly use Angelic Missile to fire myself to the top of the highest peak in the fields, and look around. Not a thing in sight. Only 3 powers left.

I mentally map out the spaces around me, and slowly deduct routes based on safety, stealthiness, and accessibility. A few to choose from, but not narrow enough. I then think to myself "If I were to want to go unnoticed, while knowing how my opponent thinks about reasoning, where would I go?" ...I then make my decision, leaving the Flintlock behind in order to travel lighter. I use Jump Glide to get to the grazes of the route, and cast Interference, cancelling your cloak. Only 1 power remaining...

No words... I walk up slowly, as if I have something to say. However, no words... Only Spite. One use drains all my life force to expel power of unprecedented magnitude, enveloping any and all within it's blast radius. I look at it, I look at you, and a few seconds pass.
